snippet: Jonathan Roth, 22, is said by the Nassau County district attorney to have been part of a scheme by his father, Raymond Roth, to collect his own life insurance money.
abstract: Jonathan Roth is charged with aiding scheme by his father, Raymond Roth, to collect life insurance money by faking his own death; son had called emergency officials reporting the elder Roth's disappearance after swimming off Jones Beach, and after an exhaustive search he was presumed dead; days later, when South Carolina police pulled Raymond Roth over for speeding, the scheme started to unravel.
lead_paragraph: Jonathan Roth, 22, is said by the Nassau County district attorney to have been part of a scheme by his father, Raymond Roth, to collect his own life insurance money.

headline.seo: Charges for Raymond Roth’s Son in Faked Drowning Off Long Island
headline.main: Son Is Charged in Case of Faked Drowning
headline.print_headline: Son Is Charged in Case of Faked Drowning
